column4: I insalled a driver for my DWL-G520 rev b on windows in order to get it to work with airopeek, and it made my device not be able to start properly. Is this a hardware problem do you think, or could I use ubuntu to use my card to learn more about my wireless network by snorting traffic?
i'd verify that the thing isn't broken first  ;)
: PCI card, DWL-G520 rev b (a dlink)
at console use lspci and make sure the device is listing
I'm not on ubuntu right now but I know it works for browsing the web etc, that isn't the problem.
I want to be able to snort traffic from my router without connecting to it.
have you verified that your card is supported to do that?..... (if you are using ndiswrappers than the odds are slim)

Well there was a driver on the site designed exactly for my model card (including the rev B part, which apparently according to google throws people off) but as I said it made my card not work. This was for windows, though. How would I find out if the hardware is capable? It is a DWL-G520 Rev b
maddler: investigate what type of chipset it uses
if it uses atheros then you should be fine
look on the manufacturers site for detailed specs and checkto see what chipset it uses

KoruptidPrydethat's the difference between rev a and b, b uses atheros... but the windows driver made my card unusable.. so do you know if I can find a driver for that card that wil llet me snort on ubuntu?
then you should be able to do just about everything with it under linux
i'd try a iwlist scan to verify your card is scanning and such properly
